solTitle: Secure solutions to level up your network safety

services.title: Unified Threat Management (UTM)
services.content: It is a single security system aimed at information security that offers various security functions for a single point on the network. This includes features like anti-malware, network firewalls, anti-virus, anti-spam, content filter, and leakage prevention, detection and prevention of intrusion.

services.title: Next-Generation Firewall (NGFW)
services.content: The NGFW is capable of detecting and preventing sophisticated threats with the implementation of device, port and network security policies. As it is a part of the third generation firewall technology it can be executed by either hardware or software.

services.title: Intrusion Prevention Systems (IPS)
services.content: It helps track the malicious activity on the network or system as part of the network security framework. Some of its major functions include detection of malicious activity, gathering details about such activities, reporting it and block/stop it.

services.title: NAC/ AAA
services.content: Network Access Control (NAC) systems allow for access management and network surveillance by imposing certain policies on corporate network users and devices. These solutions are meant to allow organizations to have more control over access to their networks via profiling and visibility, guest network access, policy lifecycle management, incidence response, security posture check, and bidirectional integration. While Authentication, Authorization, and Accounting (AAA) are the key to mediate network access.

services.title: Web/Email Gateway Protection
services.content: To ensure web-email protection, secure gateways are used which provide pre-delivery protection by blocking harmful emails before they reach the mail server. The gateway scans the mails for any signs of malicious content in incoming and outgoing mails including the attachments and URLs.
